label: A3B_hP8_185_c_a-001
title: $\beta$-RuCl$_{3}$ Structure
comments:
The crystal structure of both $\alpha$- and $\beta$-RuCl$_{3}$ is somewhat uncertain: 
 $\alpha$-RuCl$_{3}$ has been reported in the \href{current_web_home_dir/A3B_hP24_151_3c_2a-001}{trigonal CrCl$_{3}$ ($D0_{4}$) structure} (Fletcher, 1967) and in the \href{current_web_home_dir/AB3_mC16_12_g_ij-001}{monoclinic AlCl$_{3}$ structure} (Johnson, 2015). 
 (Fletcher, 1967) states that the structure of $\beta$-RuCl$_{3}$ is consistent with the hexagonal space groups $P6_{3}cm$ \#185 (this structure), $P6c2$ \#188, and $P6_{3}/mcm$ \#193, in addition to the trigonal space group $P3c1$ \#158, which we present here: \href{current_web_home_dir/A3B_hP8_158_d_a-001}{trigonal $\beta$-RuCl$_{3}$ (A3B\_hP8\_158\_d\_a)}. 
 Space group $P6_{3}cm$ \#185 allows an arbitary choice of the origin of the $z$-axis.  Here we set $z_{1} = 0$ for the ruthenium (2a) atoms.
